instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.R5281: What is R5281? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not recognizing battery
threads.message:
I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that came in today totally dead but green light on the charger. The logic board showed no signs of water damage at all.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> was 1,5V and Pin 1 on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> was only 6.5V. Removed <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and the voltage raised to 16.5V on pin 1. With a new <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> I got 12.5V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and it booted just fine.
Now my problem is that I get an X on the battery indicator in OSX and the battery doesn't charge. The BIL shows nothing when pressing the button.
It acts the same with or without the BIL connected. When measuring <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> they both have the correct resistance and the voltage is 3.4V on both.

Am I looking at a bad SMC here or is there anything else that I should check?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not recognizing battery
threads.message:
Check battery bus with o-scope.
You should see some pulses there, even without battery.
If SMC is OK and no other component involved is bad.
Normally even simply voltmeter detects some activity; 3.42-3.15V-3.42V...
If you see that without battery, but not with it, then bad battery.
The TVS diode and <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> can make problems too.
Post voltages for <TRANSISTOR>Q7050</TRANSISTOR> too.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not recognizing battery
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not recognizing battery
threads.message: I have replaced the SMC now, everything ok, thank you both :)
